alert.note: Alert for Buchanan; Dickenson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:57AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Virginia and southern West Virginia, including the following counties, in southwest Virginia, Buchanan and Dickenson. In southern West Virginia, Fayette, Logan, McDowell, Mingo, Raleigh and Wyoming. * WHEN...Until 200 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1053 AM EST, Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. Several road closures have been reported throughout the warned area, primarily in rural locations. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grundy, Pineville, Haysi, Mount Hope, Oceana, Hanover, Big Rock, Dry Creek, and Prosperity. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
